title: Problem Patching League of Legends

embed.description: Imgur: The most awesome images on the Internet.

body: So what has been happening over the past two days is that when I'm not playing a game, just have league open, already signed and just looking at the home screen (shown in the 2nd picture with the link above). Yesterday, I was doing just that and 6 times, that message popped up saying to restart. And I did, thinking it would fix itself, which it did not do. So I re-downloaded league yesterday night and proceeded to update the client and then close it once if had finished. So opened up league an hour ago, left it open just like I did yesterday and then checked on it. Which upon doing that I see the message that said "There seems to be a problem with patching league of Legends. We'll restore a backup version and try updating it again after you restart the patcher." (Link to the message that popped is above). So if you could please tell me why this is happening that would be great, also I reported a bug about constantly reconnecting to any game I try to play, including custom. Which I know you are working on. Maybe this helps solve it or complicate it, I don't know. If you are able to figure out why this message pops, great. Hope everything gets solved.

replies.body:
It sounds like a lot of the issues you're experiencing are caused by a *poor or unstable connection* to our servers. To ensure your local settings are configured properly, I suggest working through the steps inside our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) in their entirety.

If you continue to experience issues after taking those steps, let me know.

Yes, it is very likely it could be that since I am using internet provided at school, which someone apparently decided de-dos last weekend. I will go through the connection guide to see if I can fix anything. Thank you.
